Cornoavirus Tracker

We set up a system for reporters to input and track cases and deaths that are announced at daily press conferences. We scraped that data and piped it into a mobile-first dashboard. My duties were primarily front-end.

Published April 2020

24 hours in Crisis

Thirty reporters logged minute-by-minute reports, detailing a day during the height of the first wave. My job was to predict what they would bring back, and create templates to rapidly process and present the assets and text.

Education Homepage

We created a React app, powered by a Google form. I performed market research, created wireframes, chose branding and designed accompanying social assets. I also trained editors on how to input and curate the homepage daily.

Published March 2020

Cornoavirus Tracker

When hurricanes and wind storms hit, residents want to know if they are the only ones experiencing power outages. I designed the front end and social assets, conducted user-experience tests, and coordinated with newsroom editors to create the resource guides.

Published April 2020

Business Database

During the government-mandated shut-down, residents wondered which local businesses were still open. I created a crowdsourcing form and trained reporters to vett entries. I designed the front end using our brand guidelines and wrote the site's copy.

Published March 2020

Gone at 15

I added a suicide hotline button at the top of this story to enable readers to get immediate help if they needed it. After it's publication, it was nominated for several awards and state education leaders vowed to invest more money into student mental health services.

The Day that changed Everything

I dug through archival photos and requested drone footage for this long-form feature. After publication, a film company bought the rights to the story.

Syd the Star

An article about a rising Olympic athlete and fashion icon deserved an edgy design. I dreamed big and added angular text sections, photomontages, and sleek training GIFs.

Published March 2020

The Hero We Deserve

It was supposed to be an Esquire-like profile, but the infamous Philidelphia Flyer's mascot wouldn't sit still for a portrait. I worked with what we had and designed a feature that was as zany as the orange monster himself.

Published March 2020

Student Press Coalition

Taylor University censored it's student press, so I researched how 136 sister-institutions treated their student newspapers. Our survey and subsquent publication of the results, sparked a national conversation and change.
